parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF11240060), indicating it's likely associated with an official campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly promotes REPER, a political party participating in the parliamentary elections, and indicates its position (#19) on the ballot.  This directly refers to a candidate (the party itself) participating in the election, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, it's designed to reach a wide audience, not just individuals. The use of Facebook as a platform inherently targets a broad public, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective is to encourage voters to choose REPER in the upcoming elections. The phrase "Votează cu încredere, nu cu frică!" ("Vote with confidence, not with fear!") directly urges voters to support REPER. This clearly aims to influence the vote, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks journalistic objectivity. It's promotional material, not a news report or analysis. It doesn't present different viewpoints or provide balanced information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The message is not a personal opinion; it's a direct call to action for a specific political party.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>932185282168985</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria of electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers directly to a candidate (REPER), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook campaign, and has the clear objective of influencing voters to support REPER. The post's content, including the call to vote "with confidence, not with fear," and the prominent display of the party's ballot position, strongly suggests an intention to sway public opinion.  The presence of a CMF number further reinforces this conclusion.  While the post doesn't explicitly mention advising voters at polling stations, its clear intent to promote REPER during the election period makes it electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>REPER</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>REPER</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
REPER Brașov, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 932185282168985) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care constituie propagandă electorală, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea partidului REPER. Postarea, cu un buget de sub 100 RON,  conține îndemnul explicit „Votează cu încredere, nu cu frică!”,  precum și poziția partidului pe buletinul de vot (#19),  adresându-se unui public larg prin intermediul unei campanii plătite pe Facebook,  ajungând la 4.000-5.000 de impresii și având o estimare a acoperirii de 100.000-500.000 de persoane.  Prezența numărului CMF11240060 confirmă natura oficială a materialului de propagandă electorală.  Aceste elemente demonstrează clar intenția de a influența votul în favoarea REPER, încălcând prevederile legale privind continuarea propagandei electorale după încheierea perioadei legale. Contact: campaniereper@gmail.com, +40757521109, Calea Griviței 73-75, Sector 1, București, Romania 010734, RO.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
